programme.title: Fatal Attraction
programme.desc: Michael Brooks and Dorothy Washington were just settling into their budding new↵relationship. But when Michael is brutally gunned down inside Dorothy’s apartment, their steamy romance would be forever put on hold. As law enforcement attempt to piece together what happened, they uncover a twisted tale of lies, jealousy, and violence. ↵

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When 22-year-old airport baggage handler Erika Yancey goes missing, friends and family scramble with law enforcement to find her. Erika had a habit of meeting strangers online, which leads her family to fear that she may have gotten caught up with the wrong person. But once the search gets going, a steamy affair and a tangled love triangle will be revealed that will send the case spiraling in a whole new direction. The question isn’t only if they’ll find Erika…it’s if they’ll find her alive.↵↵

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: One early morning at around 12am, Jerrick Jackson and his fiancé were coming home from a night out. When they pulled into their driveway, they are met by several assailants who aim to rob them of their belongings. As the robbery escalates, Jerrick tries to stop them from going into his home. Shots are fired and Jerrick is hit and ends up dead. This is now a homicide and Quinn and Vince rush to the scene. They quickly uncover that crime has no age limit and focus in on a group of teens who ended Jerrick’s life on that fateful early morning.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: On a warm summer morning in June of 2014, Darius Bottoms leaves his friend’s apartment after a fun-filled night of video games. When he gets into his car and starts driving away, he notices two figures standing in front of and behind his car. They start firing gunshots and Darius is dead on scene. Quinn and Vince are designated the case and after figuring the culprits were gang-related, they realize this whole thing could be a case of mistaken identity.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: When a beloved landlord is found strangled with her nostrils glued closed, police struggle to find a motive for the bizarre killing until surveillance footage leads them to a shocking duo of killers on a quest for revenge.

programme.desc: In Louisville, Kentucky, a young woman is killed overnight during a botched raid on her apartment. Her outraged community comes together to demand her killers be brought to justice and sparks a nationwide call for police reform.

programme.desc: Clinton, Illinois, single mom Amanda Hamm turns a workplace fling into true romance. She will stop at nothing to protect her love, even if it means allowing her children to sink to a watery grave. Later, April Barber lights her whole life in flames to keep her baby and her man.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: NBC Nightly News With Tom Llamas

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: A Georgia couple's romantic tryst takes a deadly turn, leaving investigators stumped -- until tire treads at the scene and cell phone calls reveal a twisted plot.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: After a young mom is found dead on the side of a country road, 40 miles from her Knoxville home, investigators scramble to figure out how she ended up there.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: Robert Davis, who was convicted of murdering a woman and her son, claims his confession was coerced and tries to prove he is innocent.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: When detectives track down the killer of a Las Vegas cocktail waitress and mother, it becomes clear that the investigation has just begun.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: A man who was recently acquitted of the murder of his ex-girlfriend's 12-year-old son tells his story; interview with the victim's mother and key players in the case.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: A chance encounter by custom agents leads to a break in the case of a mother who disappeared days before she was supposed to move to a new city with her young son; 20 years after the incident, a witness speaks out.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: A son uncovers a dark family conspiracy when he questions his mother following a man's apparent suicide.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: Against all odds, a young woman is found alive after an attack on her and a friend near Corpus Christi, Texas.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: Campus cops make a terrible discovery in a dorm room after a boyfriend's weekend visit goes horribly wrong.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: When a former hockey player discovers his wife murdered in their home, his daughter says she saw a burglar.

programme.title: Sunday Today With Willie Geist
programme.desc: Sharp conversational coverage of the week's news, along with in-depth profiles of the people and personalities shaping American culture, assessing the highs and lows of the week and looking ahead to the next one.

programme.title: Meet the Press
programme.desc: Interviews with public figures and those making news, setting the political agenda and spotlighting the impact Washington decision-making has on Americans.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: A look at the crimes committed by Charles Manson and his followers in 1969, including archival footage and interviews with those close to the events.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: After losing a hotly contested custody battle, a woman disappears with her 11-month-old daughter; the child's father searches four continents for almost two decades before reaching an emotional conclusion.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: A doctor ingests a lethal chemical, causing friends to wonder if it was an attempt at suicide or if he was poisoned -- until a love triangle is uncovered.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: Four years after a 28-year-old dies after hosting a New Year's Eve party, a jury must decide if it was suicide or murder.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: After a sudden marriage creates tension between two families, a murder exposes secrets, lies and a long-buried mystery.

programme.title: Dateline NBC

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The pufferfish is poisonous and if eaten by a human, the venom can affect one's diaphragm and can cause death by suffocation. And, in just 5 seconds, the hummingbird can flap its wings 350 times. Plus, the importance of the Elephant in the Serengeti.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we visit South Carolina. Philippe joins the Department of Natural Resources to tag tiger sharks in Port Royal Sound. Then we head inland for a hike to find wild venus fly traps. From there it's back to the shoreline of Port Royal Sound to examine ecosystem indicators through three different species of crab. Finally Congaree National Park is home to the largest hardwood forest in the US.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we head to the beautiful landscape of Glacier National Park. Philippe heads out to uncover insect fossils dating back 45 million years. Then we look at the intricate geology of the park itself. From there we track one of the most important food sources of the park - wild huckleberries. And then we join a group of students participating in a citizen science expedition.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A doctor seeks revenge on the man he blames for ruining his practice.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene provides protection for the stagecoach to San Dimas, which rolls through outlaw and hostile Indian territory.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: A portrait painter plans crimes while sketching his models, who are chosen to help the artist gain financial reward.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene, Pat, and a parson rid the town of Scorpion of a gambling ring and crooked politicians.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: To save the new school, Gene bets the ranch on a chariot race.

programme.title: The Last Outlaw
programme.desc: A former bandit finds the frontier a very different place when he emerges from prison after serving 25 years.

programme.title: Ride the High Country
programme.desc: Reduced to transporting gold from a distant mine to a small-town bank, retired lawman Steve Judd (Joel McCrea) recruits friend Gil Westrum (Randolph Scott), who has been performing in a traveling carnival. Unknown to Steve, the restless Gil and a young drifter intend to steal the next gold transport. On the way, the men help Elsa Knudsen (Mariette Hartley) to break free from her zealot father and join her fiance at the mine, not realizing the consequences that await them all.

programme.title: Tall Man Riding
programme.desc: A few years ago, Larry Madden (Randolph Scott) left his fiancée, Corinna (Dorothy Malone), after a run-in with her father, the wealthy land owner Tucker Ordway (Robert Barrat). After saving a man (William Ching) from a vicious attack, Larry learns hen is actually Corinna's new husband, and that some of the locals are preparing to challenge Tucker's land ownership. When Larry decides to ride back into town and make a claim himself, he encounters a few unexpected obstacles.

programme.title: The Hanged Man
programme.desc: Miraculously still alive after his hanging, a gunfighter in need of redemption defends a beautiful young widow's farm from a vicious land grabber.

programme.title: Gunsmoke in Tucson
programme.desc: An outlaw leader (Mark Stevens) and his lawman brother (Forrest Tucker) straddle a feud between farmers and cattlemen.

programme.title: Badman's Territory
programme.desc: After Jesse and Frank James rob a bank in a northern Texas country, Sheriff Mark Rowley (Randolph Scott) and his deputy brother Johnny (James Warren) pursue them into the "Badlands" territory, an outlaw haven not associated with any government. The James brothers are also wanted by a devious federal marshal, who battles Mark for their custody. Soon Mark and Johnny are embroiled with the Dalton Gang and an effort by a female newspaper owner (Ann Richards) to make the territory part of Oklahoma.

programme.title: Return of the Bad Men
programme.desc: In 1889 in Oklahoma Territory, the land rush attracts thousands, including many outlaws. A gang led by Wild Bill Doolan includes the Sundance Kid (Robert Ryan) and the Younger brothers, who intend to take advantage of the confusion to rob banks. Doolan's daughter, Cheyenne (Anne Jeffreys), helps the gang in a heist, but is wounded and taken in by ex-ranger Vance Cordell (Randolph Scott). Vance sets about to change her allegiance, despite the misgivings of his fiancée (Jacqueline White).

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Two prison wagon drivers stop at the McCain ranch looking for whiskey. Lucas turns them down because they are escorting a murderer, to be hanged in Yuma.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Corey Hazlett insists he's innocent of murder, despite Lucas's eyewitness testimony.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas tries to dissuade a latter-day knight from rushing into battle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Abe Lincoln's claim that he's the Great Emancipator amuses everyone except Matt Yordy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Stubborn Grandpa Fogarty is Lucas's main roadblock as he tries to get young Woody Fogarty to attend school.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas tries to stop embittered John Holliver from venting his wrath on the people who expelled him from town years before.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas becomes the target of a vengeful mountaineer after he is responsible for a young mountain boy's death.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Mark is kidnapped and held for ransom, he finds himself an unwilling companion of gunman Carl Avery.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas seeks an escape when he's captured by outlaws while seeking help for an injured Mark.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas looks for answers when recovering alcoholic Micah Torrence returns to the bottle and turns in his badge.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: In a ghost town, Lucas, Mark and Micah tangle with the Newman family and learn the secret of the town's 20-year-old mystery of a lost gold mine.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Blinded in an explosion, Lucas fights despair as he prepares for a meeting with a gun-toting enemy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A deranged ex-prisoner of war, cruelly abused in a Northern army prison, captures Lucas, locks him in a cage and vows to make him suffer for his part in the Civil War.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is threatened with hanging by a lynch party when some horses he has purchased in a neighboring town turn out to be stolen.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A janitor-turned-gunfighter's reputation hangs on one lucky shot and a lot of gall. The handyman finds himself in trouble when he accidentally kills another gunfighter.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas tries to get help when he is shot after witnessing a murder.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: After being foreman of a jury that convicted an Apache, Lucas is marked for death. Now, he must discover who is behind the curse.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Two pranksters write away for a mail-order bride, using Lucas's name.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas recognizes Dr. Battle as an ex-gunslinger with whom he once fought. He helps with a dying man, but Lucas and the doctor have unresolved anger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A Chinese man and his son fight prejudice as they try to open a laundry in North Fork.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: While Lucas and Mark are traveling across the Mexican desert they encounter a trio of Mexican bandits who demand payment to cross "their" desert.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark and Milly are held hostage in her general store when two gunmen attempt a daring robbery.

programme.desc: Two prison wagon drivers stop at the McCain ranch looking for whiskey. Lucas turns them down because they are escorting a murderer, to be hanged in Yuma.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark goes to work for Will Temple, a badly scarred, very mysterious rancher.

programme.desc: Corey Hazlett insists he's innocent of murder, despite Lucas's eyewitness testimony.

programme.desc: Stubborn Grandpa Fogarty is Lucas's main roadblock as he tries to get young Woody Fogarty to attend school.

programme.desc: Lucas tries to stop embittered John Holliver from venting his wrath on the people who expelled him from town years before.

programme.desc: When Mark is kidnapped and held for ransom, he finds himself an unwilling companion of gunman Carl Avery.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas seeks an escape when he's captured by outlaws while seeking help for an injured Mark.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The young Queen-to-be of France hides out in North Fork with her sick brother.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A notorious killer is being held in the North Fork jail. When word gets around that Gordo's gang is on its way to free him, the whole town becomes frightened.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas's old Army pal settles in North Fork with his deaf daughter.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark falls head-over-heels in puppy love.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Banker Hamilton is closing up for the day when Rudy Gray persuades him to stay open for one more transaction...a withdrawal at gunpoint.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Tip Corey, the son of a man allegedly murdered in North Fork, has a killer's reputation and comes to town to kill Micah.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Len Richards and his brother, Ab, confront a Lucas McCain look-alike, Earl Bantry and his sidekick K.C. Peters, for slaughtering one of Richards' steers.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark and Milly are shocked when Lucas begins gambling. They don't know that Lucas is "undercover" trying to catch a man cheating.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark befriends singer-banjoist Lafayette Bly, a blind man with an acute sense of hearing and a very strong grip.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A retired lawman's irrational jealousy threatens not only to destroy his marriage but also to make him an easy target for someone who wants him dead.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: No one is more surprised than Micah when newcomer Leota Carraway claims he's her long-lost husband and the father of her child.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The town of North Fork becomes a haven for outlaws when suave Ben Judson smooth-talks his way into the marshal's job.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A handsome gambler moves into town and begins wooing Milly Scott, claiming to have known her deceased brother.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas develops temporary amnesia from a head injury while visiting a strange town and mistakenly assumes the identity of a wanted criminal.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A former neighbor of the McCains' is released from jail after serving his sentence for robbery. Lucas lets the man work for him but the new hand holds a secret.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: While trapped in the ghost town saloon, Lucas tries to come up with a plan to escape with his son and Micah after Mark refuses to leave without him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lou Mallory arrives in North Fork and starts buying up land and businesses. Lou and Lucas start disliking each other after she reveals plans to build a railroad on "worthless" land.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When a woman arrives in North Fork with symptoms of smallpox, Lucas, Lou Mallory, Doctor Burrage and hotel occupants are quarantined in the hotel with an outlaw.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Gunslinger Johnny Drako rides into town and tells the bartender that he is looking for Lucas McCain. After Johnny leaves the saloon, Sweeney hurries to tell Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An assassination plot unfolds as four gunmen disguised as cavalrymen enter North Fork. Their target: Sen. Jim Borden. Their weapon: a Gatling gun.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Sharpshooter Marty Blair tries to persuade Lucas to buy Mark a rifle. After Lucas shoots a man during a robbery at the hotel, Mark and Lucas disagree his character.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Fast-draw artist Wade Randall is in town, bragging of his gun battles with notorious bad men, until one of them shows up to challenge his story.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Lucas refuses to sell his land, Mr. Prescott will stop at nothing to to change his mind. He hires men to try to persuade Lucas, but he refuses.

programme.desc: Mark and Milly are shocked when Lucas begins gambling. They don't know that Lucas is "undercover" trying to catch a man cheating.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A retired lawman's irrational jealousy threatens not only to destroy his marriage but also to make him an easy target for someone who wants him dead.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: No one is more surprised than Micah when newcomer Leota Carraway claims he's her long-lost husband and the father of her child.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is torn by conflicting emotions when he meets the town's new preacher, a former outlaw whom the Rifleman vowed to kill.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The town of North Fork becomes a haven for outlaws when suave Ben Judson smooth-talks his way into the marshal's job.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas develops temporary amnesia from a head injury while visiting a strange town and mistakenly assumes the identity of a wanted criminal.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When a convicted killer escapes prison, Josh is hired to protect the woman whose testimony put him there. The woman's husband is a lawyer who says he has always been a coward and never carries a gun.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides into a town looking for a man who wants to hire him. When he goes to the man's room at the hotel, Josh is shot. He must figure out who shot him but the sheriff is ordering him out of town.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by Harry Weaver to track down his twin brother Pete, a wanted man. Harry is tired of being used by Pete, plus the law and bounty hunters are apt to mistake him for Pete.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is called in to track down a new outlaw, the local sheriff who is a friend. The good sheriff who was seduced into robbing a bank by his girlfriend, convinces Josh to let him assist in her capture

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting a deaf teenage girl and keeping everyone off the father's place for a day or two. Although initially bored, Josh starts to develop a relationship with the friendly girl.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A broke Josh is hired by a fearful man to help him elope with his sweetheart, Jane, the daughter of a local rancher. The girl's father is vehemently opposed to the marriage.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting an express office employee who stole $10,000 and wants to return it before it's discovered missing. However, he had an accomplice and does not know where the accomplice is.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A Japanese woman travels to the U.S. to find a man who proposed to her and hires Josh to find him since no one will help her. Josh is confronted by the Japanese man to whom she had been promised.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in town thinking the sheriff summoned him to go after a man. Instead, a woman wants Josh to bring in the man, her wanted husband, alive, so he can prove self defense.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides to Barney Durant's horse business right after Barney pushes his son to leave. When Josh's prisoners escape taking 2 horses from his horse trader friend, he helps in tracking them down.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is summoned for help when the Pinto bank is robbed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh expects a bounty for bringing in Daniel Trenner but his prisoner is stolen by the sheriff. Ex-army personnel want to stage an illegal trial accusing their former lieutenant of dereliction of duty

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by a woman to sober up Harry, a drunk who is also Josh's friend. She learned his wealthy brother who Harry hasn't seen in years is coming to visit so she wants Harry to be presentable.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is on his way to River City to transport three convicts there to be hanged. The dangerous prisoners escape and appoint themselves the law, after the town is hit by a tornado, killing the sheriff.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A journalist accompanies Josh on his manhunt to get an exclusive story on a bounty hunter. Josh agrees to let him join him in the hunt for Jack Torrance but finds they have different methods.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh feels compelled to repay a debt to an old friend who's in jail and may hang. However, the friend escapes, forcing Josh to go on the hunt for him until it appears he died when he went over a cliff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is sent for by the desperate men of Coronado. He is hired to convince the women of the town to come back to their men when they leave demanding that all towns men give up their guns for good.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in a man wanted for robbery but loses his reward. A well meaning doctor pays an innocent man to take the blame for his son, but the son sets out to kill the man to make sure he never tells

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in a town for rest just as the local bank has been robbed. A traveling medicine man knows the whereabouts of the suspect and wants Josh to help because he thinks the suspect is innocent.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A widow wants to hire/propose to Josh so she doesn't lose custody of her son. Josh served under her husband in the war. His mother now is trying to steal her grandson to take over the family fortune.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When Randall has a sheriff bed a prisoner, the man's gang kidnaps the sheriff and two others and threatens to kill one per day until the man is freed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: In Mexico, Josh is hired to protect a man and his pregnant wife from his the villagers who are angered when he refuses the town healing woman or "witch" from being present when his wife gives birth.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: After Josh takes the task of finding a man and his wife's pet ewe, he becomes the butt of many jokes while cattlemen nearly hang him when he mentions sheep. His only clue is a gold bell the ewe wore.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A disoriented young woman in a bunny costume checks into the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pregnant ER doctor is endangered by a seemingly invincible violent patient.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young boy at a sleepover party mysteriously loses control of his arms and legs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A young girl, recently hit by a hockey puck, is now mysteriously paralyzed from the waist down.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man has a sword impaled in his head in a roleplaying battle, a patient is terrified of germs and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A teen is bleeding internally from an ectopic pregnancy but denies ever having had sex.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An off-duty ER physician diagnoses his own critical illness while en route to the hospital.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: Labor Pains
programme.desc: A doctor delivers a baby in a car and another one to parents unaware they were expecting.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pregnant woman's leg pain turns out to be flesh-eating virus, threatening life and limb; a Desert Storm war veteran swallows razor blades on a dare; a bride-to-be spends her wedding day in the ER after collapsing at the altar.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A surfer is impaled between the legs by the fin of his surfboard.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An unconscious woman is bleeding internally. A man with a 4-day erection needs extraordinary help.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two patients are admitted into the ER, both experiencing seizures. An elderly man's lung collapses.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors use a robot operated by a specialist at another hospital to treat a seizing 7-year-old boy.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Three patients sneak their pets into the hospital, causing pandemonium in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman gets stuck in a toilet bowl; a man's leg is mangled by a stump grinder; a nurse collapses.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: This special episodes features ten of the craziest stories from the first 100 episodes.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two seemingly unrelated gunshot wounds lead to a bizarre night in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A live boa constrictor wrapped around a man's arm is biting his wrist and won't let go.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S01:E08 - Episode 8

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. First up is Mayfair, with a prime location on the busy seafront in Fuengirola, Costa del Sol. The restaurant was set up 28 years ago by 68 year old Londoner Pat and her husband of 45 years, Jack. The good news is that Fuengirola is one of the only towns in Spain that has actually seen an increase in tourists since the recession with 1 and half million Brits visiting last year alone; the bad news is that Mayfair isn't benefitting. With thousands of hungry sun seekers right on its doorstep, the restaurant should be raking it in - but the place is totally empty.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode two sees Gordon tackle struggling Le Deck restaurant in Capbreton, a popular coastal town in South West France. British owners Tim and Debbie emigrated to France 28 years ago, where they met as holiday reps. Since then they've poured blood, sweat and tears into opening 3 ski restaurants in the Alps. With the arrival of their children, they set up home by the coast to enjoy the summer months together as a family. But unable to sit still, Tim launched Le Deck three years ago. Far from being a hobby, the restaurant has taken over his life.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode 3 sees Gordon travel to the stunning whitewashed mountain village of Gaucin, half an hour from the Costa del Sol. In a series first, Gordon is tackling a brand new up-market start up restaurant, La Granada Divino, it's only been open for 8 weeks but is already heading for disaster. Owned by architect Milan and former model Gina, they have never run a restaurant and have sunk their savings and retirement fund in to the place.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. This final episode in the series takes Gordon to the Costa Blanca and a sleepy village that's home to Quelcutti's restaurant and bar, run by the Quelcutti family. Former London cabbie Del and his wife Sue emigrated to Spain 10 years ago with their three children: Joe, Terry and daughter Ruby. The plan was to retire and live the dream while using their retirement money to set up a business for their kids to run. Unfortunately, the kids are running the business into the ground.

programme.title: Spiders

programme.title: An American Werewolf in Paris
programme.desc: An American tourist finds himself becoming involved with a French woman who also happens to be able to supernaturally turn into a werewolf.

programme.title: Zombie Night
programme.desc: As night falls, the dead rise. The people of a small town must fight to survive. With Anthony Michael Hall.

programme.title: Charlie's Farm
programme.desc: Ignoring warnings, four friends head into the Australian outback to visit the site where a violent family met their end at the hands of an angry mob.

programme.title: Hollow Creek
programme.desc: A popular horror novelist heads to spooky Appalachia in search of inspiration, and becomes the prime suspect in a missing person case.

programme.title: Dead Awake
programme.desc: A woman who begins investigating the deaths of victims who suffered from sleep paralysis soon finds she must save herself from an ancient evil.

programme.title: Zoombies
programme.desc: When a rapidly spreading virus turns animals of a safari park into the undead, those left inside must stop them before they zombify the whole city.

programme.title: Zombie Night
programme.desc: As night falls, the dead rise. The people of a small town must fight to survive. With Anthony Michael Hall.

programme.title: An American Werewolf in Paris
programme.desc: An American tourist finds himself becoming involved with a French woman who also happens to be able to supernaturally turn into a werewolf.

programme.title: Apollo 18
programme.desc: Decades-old found footage involving three astronauts and an abandoned, secret NASA mission reveals why the U.S. has never returned to the moon.

programme.title: Raging Sharks
programme.desc: A bizarre outbreak of shark attacks terrorizes the crew of an underwater outpost years after an alien space vessel crashed in the Bermuda Triangle.

programme.title: Eye See You
programme.desc: After witnessing a brutal scene on the job, a shaken cop checks into a rehab clinic, where he finds his fellow patients are being murdered one by one.

programme.title: Living Dark: The Story of Ted the Caver
programme.desc: Based on an internet legend, the tale of reunited brothers traces their descent into a cave, as they confront the nightmare that killed their father.

programme.title: Maneater
programme.desc: When an escaped Bengal tiger terrorizes a small Appalachian town, it’s up to the local sheriff, a game-hunter, and a gifted boy to stop the creature.

programme.title: Body Count
programme.desc: A fun group of college kids, led by two alpha males and a wild blonde, see their Colorado wilderness trip become a horrific murder spree by a stalker.

programme.title: Maniac Cop III: Badge of Silence
programme.desc: A young female cop is framed for murder. She falls in love with the Maniac Cop, who seeks out justice for her, no matter the cost.

programme.title: Spiders 2
programme.desc: Rescued from a shipwreck, a couple soon falls prey to a deranged doctor who wants to use them as incubators for a giant spider's eggs.

programme.title: The Vault
programme.desc: Forced by desperate circumstances, two sisters rob a bank and are given instructions to check an old vault, where something dark resides.

programme.title: George A. Romero Presents: Deadtime Stories Volume 1
programme.desc: An anthology of horror tales depicts a woman searching for her husband in the jungles of South America, a man finding a jade box on a beach that holds something sinister, and a doctor finding -- during a house call -- a boy with a mysterious illness.

programme.title: Stonehearst Asylum
programme.desc: An Oxford University grad is horrified by the staff at a mental asylum he works for who are performing horrific and inhumane experimental treatments.

programme.title: The Stepfather
programme.desc: After murdering his entire family, a man remarries a widow with a teenage daughter in another town and prepares to do the same thing all over again.

programme.title: Messiah of Evil
programme.desc: After receiving unsettling letters from her artist father, a woman travels to a seaside California town to find it governed by a strange, undead cult.

programme.title: Slaughterhouse Rock
programme.desc: Plagued by sinister dreams, a college student and his friends sneak into Alcatraz, where demons, murderers, and unexplainable anomalies await them.

programme.title: Uninvited
programme.desc: When a mutated cat escapes a lab study, it becomes the unlikely foil to a shady businessman’s banking scam aboard a yacht headed to the Caribbean.

programme.title: Bloodsucking Bastards
programme.desc: A loser and a slacker who work at a bleak telemarketing company discover their new boss is a vampire who is turning their coworkers into bloodsuckers.

programme.title: Alligator
programme.desc: After it’s flushed down the toilet, a baby alligator grows to monstrous size as it prowls the city sewers. Chaos erupts when it comes to the surface.

programme.title: The Nest
programme.desc: The quiet town of North Port is being overrun by cockroaches, and its sheriff is pinning the blame on the INTEC Corporation’s genetic experiments.

programme.title: Open Grave
programme.desc: A man wakes in a pit of corpses with no memory and joins strangers to uncover the truth, only to face a darker, deadlier threat to their survival.

programme.title: Rabid (1977)
programme.desc: An experimental surgery leaves an injured motorcyclist with a thirst for human blood, spreading a disease that turns people into ravenous monsters.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World

Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's crew of waterfowl hunters get together for their annual Louisiana duck hunt. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and Michael Pitts head down south to get on the ducks. There's a lot of ducks around, but they're playing hard to get. So, the guys have to get creative to make it happen.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: With duck seasons coming to a close across the country, Realtree's crews heads to East Central Louisiana to hunt ducks at Honey Brake Lodge. There's still plenty of ducks in the area after the arctic cold snap the affected the country, and it shows!!!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson finds himself deep in the heart of Peru and focuses on completing the prestigious South America Upland Slam. With only one bird remaining, the Western Peruvian Dove, the trip has led him to a private hunting property. This final challenge will take place over a cut cornfield, a favorite spot for the doves. To blend in, Mark and his team craft a makeshift blind using a mix of corn stalks, and timber, just enough cover while allowing for a clear shot. These West Peruvian Doves are known for their erratic flight patterns, often bouncing from one tree to another in a random manner, making timing and placement critical.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nobody chases the waterfowl migration as hard as Shawn Stahl of Team Winchester. The Michigan native spends over half of his year running the highways and flyways searching for the x. In this episode, we’ll tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: East Alton, Illinois is the home of Winchester Ammunition and the manufacturing home of the shotshell plants that build and produce millions of rounds of ammo for hunters, sport shooters, military and law enforcement. Get an unprecedented inside look at the birth cycle of a shotshell inside the walls of Winchester. From hull to primer, shot to wad and packaging to shipping, watch how the most legendary and successful ammunition brand in the world comes to is born and built.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Ty’s passion for the outdoors has certainly transcended to the next generation and his kids can’t get enough! Hunter and Alexa both tagged mature bucks with one being a very typical and the other a wild nontypical in this family episode!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true? We also take you on some great hunts we’ve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like. We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and part of the old Trained Assassins Crew, Luke Mitchell (producer) and Ryan Wascom (host), head out to Colorado to chase bugling elk with their bows. Also joining the crew is one of Slade’s real estate clients and his son. Part of the deal when this client worked with Slade was that Slade lined them up an elk hunt the following fall. It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

programme.title: Wildbound by Forloh
programme.desc: In this episode Andy and his friend Scotty take on Kodiak Island, Alaska for an adventure of Salmon fishing and hunting black tail deer. Whilst traversing steep mountains in the company of Kodiak brown bears and taking on cold Alaskan waters, Andy presents useful information for fellow outdoor enthusiasts all whilst building friendships with the great people of Kodiak Big Timber Lodge.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Lindsey from The Lindsey Way is on a mission for one deer — a buck they call “Junior.” After passing him the year before, Jeff spends months trying to catch up with the elusive whitetail. He makes mistakes, second-guesses himself, and faces plenty of close calls. But exactly one year to the day after letting Junior walk, Jeff climbs back into the same stand — and this time, it all comes together.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, we're headed out to Oklahoma to follow along with the Sharp brothers as they hunt whitetails in their home state. You never know what to expect with these two but one thing you can always rely on is that they always have some big deer to go after!

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Heading to one of the great wilderness areas of North America, Dan Cabela is in search of Stone Sheep in British Columbia. Joining scientists, they embark on an ambitious conservation project to help conserve this incredible species.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: We Caught That

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everything—and the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and it’s bigger than ever. This time, we’re in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Florida’s most critical ecosystems. But it’s not just about hard work—it’s about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Don’t miss Part 1—where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Retired Army National Guard and Native American Darin Dimas details his and his familes life of patriotism while living on the reservation in beautiful Poplar Montana.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP is joined by Capt. Richard White, targeting Yellowfin Tuna on light spinning setups at Tropic Star Lodge.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair takes head of Starbrite, Greor Dornau out of Cape Canaveral for a day of fishing and ends the show fishing with Dr. Todd Osborne of the Indian River Clam restoration project all during the Starbrite Seasafe Collective weekend in an effort to support the project.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Danny joins his good buddy Trey Mikell in his truly wild backyard along the Nature Coast. The two of them are searching for big redfish in inches of water.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss looks back at some memorable entries from Season 6 of The Captain’s Log.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike tries to hold his own while fishing with Nick Fischer and Liza Fitzgerald in south seas Captiva. Good luck buddy.

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff get bit by catfish in Southern Oklahoma with YouTuber Nate Williams of Adrenaline Rush Adventures while using the most primitive fishing tactic - hand fishing. Learn from the Chickasaw Nation about the history of this method that has been used by Native Americans for thousands of years.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: Rochelle Partridge heads out after a monster framed buck, and when finally presented with an opportunity, anything could happen.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Sammy Millazo Fishing Offshore Islamorada.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team does a deep dive into a product founded by Engineered Marine Coatings called the Genius Bucket. The Genius Bucket being the ultimate DIY paint kit for those looking to tackle a marine painting job on there own. The team also checks out the capabilities it takes to restoring the older metal rub rail which derived from the Glastron project.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger meet up with Capt. Brain Wilson in Galveston, TX for a taste of what the Texas Gulf Coast has to offer.

programme.title: Into The Blue

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger go north for a change to sight fish tripletails in Florida Bay.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger head to the hump on a windy day to target tunas and find some bonus mahis and tripletails as well.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Being consistently productive on the water means knowing how to adapt to conditions. Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger switch it up and fish shallow for sailfish.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger launch from the incomparable Oceans Edge Resort in Key West, Florida to hunt down all kinds of sport fish.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree wraps up their trip to Canada with some of their harvest on the grill. Which tastes better, Sandhill Crane or Speckle Belly?

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's crew of waterfowl hunters get together for their annual Louisiana duck hunt. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and Michael Pitts head down south to get on the ducks. There's a lot of ducks around, but they're playing hard to get. So, the guys have to get creative to make it happen.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: With duck seasons coming to a close across the country, Realtree's crews heads to East Central Louisiana to hunt ducks at Honey Brake Lodge. There's still plenty of ducks in the area after the arctic cold snap the affected the country, and it shows!!!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson finds himself deep in the heart of Peru and focuses on completing the prestigious South America Upland Slam. With only one bird remaining, the Western Peruvian Dove, the trip has led him to a private hunting property. This final challenge will take place over a cut cornfield, a favorite spot for the doves. To blend in, Mark and his team craft a makeshift blind using a mix of corn stalks, and timber, just enough cover while allowing for a clear shot. These West Peruvian Doves are known for their erratic flight patterns, often bouncing from one tree to another in a random manner, making timing and placement critical.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nobody chases the waterfowl migration as hard as Shawn Stahl of Team Winchester. The Michigan native spends over half of his year running the highways and flyways searching for the x. In this episode, we’ll tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: East Alton, Illinois is the home of Winchester Ammunition and the manufacturing home of the shotshell plants that build and produce millions of rounds of ammo for hunters, sport shooters, military and law enforcement. Get an unprecedented inside look at the birth cycle of a shotshell inside the walls of Winchester. From hull to primer, shot to wad and packaging to shipping, watch how the most legendary and successful ammunition brand in the world comes to is born and built.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Ty’s passion for the outdoors has certainly transcended to the next generation and his kids can’t get enough! Hunter and Alexa both tagged mature bucks with one being a very typical and the other a wild nontypical in this family episode!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true? We also take you on some great hunts we’ve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like. We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and part of the old Trained Assassins Crew, Luke Mitchell (producer) and Ryan Wascom (host), head out to Colorado to chase bugling elk with their bows. Also joining the crew is one of Slade’s real estate clients and his son. Part of the deal when this client worked with Slade was that Slade lined them up an elk hunt the following fall. It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

programme.title: Wildbound by Forloh
programme.desc: In this episode Andy and his friend Scotty take on Kodiak Island, Alaska for an adventure of Salmon fishing and hunting black tail deer. Whilst traversing steep mountains in the company of Kodiak brown bears and taking on cold Alaskan waters, Andy presents useful information for fellow outdoor enthusiasts all whilst building friendships with the great people of Kodiak Big Timber Lodge.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Lindsey from The Lindsey Way is on a mission for one deer — a buck they call “Junior.” After passing him the year before, Jeff spends months trying to catch up with the elusive whitetail. He makes mistakes, second-guesses himself, and faces plenty of close calls. But exactly one year to the day after letting Junior walk, Jeff climbs back into the same stand — and this time, it all comes together.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, we're headed out to Oklahoma to follow along with the Sharp brothers as they hunt whitetails in their home state. You never know what to expect with these two but one thing you can always rely on is that they always have some big deer to go after!

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Heading to one of the great wilderness areas of North America, Dan Cabela is in search of Stone Sheep in British Columbia. Joining scientists, they embark on an ambitious conservation project to help conserve this incredible species.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree travels back to Arkansas and joins Rusty Creasey to hunt late season ducks.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree teams us with Aurora Skies Outfitting for another Canadian waterfowl hunt. Ducks and geese are diving into the decoys from all directions, and the barrels are heating up fast.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel compares the performance of the High Flyer Series of Kicks choke tubes to help you determine which one is best for your duck hunting scenario.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Crew continues their action-packed waterfowl hunt in Canada as the guys try to pull a few snow geese into the decoys.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Black Cloud

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Denny McMahan on this episode at the legendary Thumbtack Ranch in South Texas. Denny was nominated by his wife for Bucks for the Brave program hosted by Trinity Oaks. After dedicating his life to service in the US Army and law enforcement, he now continues the mission by teaching at the police academy. Denny is a true hero in his community - someone who sacrifices his time, his well being, and his life in service to others, never asking for anything in return.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Part II of our exclusive profile of the current state of hunting in America and whether or not we believe there is light at the end of the tunnel.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.
